definition.sentence: KBIRD is a rule-based system for concept-spotting in free text [ 2 , 7 ] .
definition.definiens: a rule-based system for concept-spotting in free

definition.sentence: KBIRD rules are forward-chaining horn clauses whose antecedents are constituents discovered and recorded in a chart data structure and whose consequents are newly inferred constituents—concepts ( or facts ) —to be added to the chart .
definition.definiens: forward-chaining horn clauses whose antecedents are constituents discovered and recorded in a chart data structure and whose consequents are newly inferred constituents—concepts ( or facts ) —to be added to the chart

definition.sentence: The KBIRD rules which propose slot fillers attach a score ( an integer between 0 and 100 ) to eac h candidate which represents the system 's confidence in that value .
definition.definiens: an integer between 0 and 100 ) to eac h candidate which represents the system 's confidence in that value

definition.sentence: Thus , it can determine that in the sentence `` Castellar is the second mayor that has been murdered in Colombia in the last 3 days '' that Castellar is the subject of the copular verb in the matrix clause , and that Castellar should inherit properties asserted of the predicate nominal argument .

The GE NLTooLSET is a set of text interpretation tools designed to be easily adapted to new domains .
definition.definiens: a set of text interpretation tools designed to be easily adapted to new domains

definition.sentence: Linguistic analysis parses each sentence and produces ( possibly alternative ) semantic interpretations at the sentence level .
definition.definiens: parses each sentence and produces ( possibly alternative ) semantic interpretations at the sentence level

definition.sentence: SUMMARY AND CONCLUSIO N MUC-3 is a very difficult task , involving a combination of language interpretation , conceptual and domain knowledge , along with many rules and strategies fo l. template filling .
definition.definiens: a very difficult task , involving a combination of language interpretation , conceptual and domain knowledge

definition.sentence: System total recall score ( matched/missing ) as a function of time during MUC-3 development .
definition.definiens: a function of time during MUC-3 development

definition.definiens: relied almost exclusively on the 100 messages in Test 1 for training after the February interim conference

MESSAGE ID TST 1-MUC3-000 1 1 .

Other key aspects of DBG , for example , the incorporation of the sublanguage approach first defined by Zellig Harris in [ 5 ] and further developed by Naomi Sage r and the NYU Linguistic String Project in [ 10 ] , have made use of existing specialized natural language under standing techniques to solve the particular problems that we have faced , such as the challenge of building a generic system that could process messages from a variety of specialized military domains .
definition.definiens: the challenge of building a generic system that could process messages from a variety of specialized military domains

definition.sentence: The DBG system consists of a series of modules that process message text in stages , and each major level o f analysis is contained in a separate module .
definition.definiens: consists of a series of modules that process message text in stages

definition.sentence: At the lexical level , the Lexical Unexpected input module ( LUX ) corrects errors by allowing partial matches betwee n words in the text and the lexical entries stored in the lexicon .
definition.definiens: corrects errors by allowing partial matches betwee n words in the text and the lexical entries stored in the lexicon

definition.sentence: The new words can also be stored for later incorporation into the system by means of a second , more extensive mode of the Word Acquisition Module ( WAM2 ) , which operates off-line to allow periodic lexicon update by the System Administrator .
definition.definiens: operates off-line to allow periodic lexicon update by the System Administrator

definition.sentence: Riley voice corpus , which consists of lower echelon voice communications collected during the four days of a training exercise , exemplifies this degree o f predictability .
definition.definiens: consists of lower echelon voice communications collected during the four days of a training exercise

definition.sentence: An example of a text grammar rule at the sentence level i s the following content rule for title sentences in launch messages from the Space Event corpus ( elements i n parentheses are optional ) : Sentence [ title ] -- > Object ( Booster ) ( Action ) Launchsite ( Time ) Dat e This information may be actualized in the title sentence of a message in a variety of lexicosyntacti c configurations .
definition.definiens: Dat e This information may be actualized in the title sentence of a message in a variety of lexicosyntacti c configurations

definition.sentence: The semantic analyzer ( based on concepts embodied in PLUM , developed at th e University of Massachusetts by Wendy Lehnert [ 1 ] ) is the major component of the system .
definition.definiens: the major component of the system

definition.sentence: Agent-s is expected to be filled by an actor-p , found previously in the same sentence , andphysical-target-s is expected to be filled by a theme-p , found later in the same sentence .
definition.definiens: expected to be filled by an actor-p , found previously in the same sentence

definition.sentence: The MITFP is a deterministic stochastic parser which does not attempt to generate a single syntactic interpretation of the whol e sentence , rather , it generates one or more parse fragments spanning the input sentence , deferring difficult decision s on attachment ambiguities .
definition.definiens: a deterministic stochastic parser which does not attempt to generate a single syntactic interpretation of the whol e sentence

definition.definiens: the object of an event )

definition.sentence: Template Generatio n The template generator takes the event structure produced by discourse processing and fills out the application specific templates .
definition.definiens: takes the event structure produced by discourse processing and fills out the application specific templates

definition.sentence: Heriberto Hernandez the Colonel ( with titles that allow postposition , preposition without `` the '' is mor e normal than postposition with `` the '' ) the Colonel ( appositives and most titles can b e used without the proper nouns an d with determiners ) Colonel ( vocative ) ( most titles can be used as vocatives ) However , `` student '' and `` peasant '' are considered appositives because of th e following pattern similar to the pattern for `` critic '' above : student Mario Flores the student Mario Flores Mario Flores the studen t the studen t ?
definition.definiens: appositives and most titles can b e used without the proper nouns an d with determiners

definition.definiens: The recall scores for postposed and preposed appositives show difference s in the scores but no clear trend as to which is easier to process

definition.sentence: Case-Based Consolidation The CBR component of consolidation is an optional part of our system , designed to increase recall rates by generating additional templates to augment the output of rule-based consolidation .
definition.definiendum: Case-Based Consolidation The CBR component of consolidation
definition.definiens: an optional part of our system , designed to increase recall rates by generating additional templates to augment the output of rule-based consolidation

definition.sentence: The CBR component uses a case base which draw s from 283 texts in the development corpus , and the 100 texts from TST1 for a total of 383 texts .
definition.definiens: uses a case base which draw s from 283 texts in the development corpus

definition.sentence: BBN 'S PLUM : THE DISCOURSE COMPONEN T The discourse component of BBN 's PLUM message processing system ( also described in BBN 's Syste m Summary in these proceedings ) is responsible for extracting events of interest from what is normally ver y fragmentary syntactic and semantic information .
definition.definiens: THE DISCOURSE COMPONEN T The discourse component of BBN 's PLUM message processing system ( also described in BBN 's Syste m Summary in these proceedings

definition.sentence: Event slots are usually filled in directly , by finding a predicate in the semantic s which corresponds directly to a discourse-event slot , and relates the form which 'triggered ' the event with a filler .
definition.definiens: usually filled in directly , by finding a predicate in the semantic s which corresponds directly to a discourse-event slot , and relates the form which 'triggered ' the event with a filler

definition.sentence: DPM DPM is a heuristically driven program that identifies segments of a story describing different domain events .
definition.definiens: a heuristically driven program that identifies segments of a story describing different domain events

definition.sentence: Three factors influence the decision as to whether a subsequent paragraph or sentenc e continues describing an event or starts describing a new event : ( 1 ) whether an event type that the current primary phrase has identified is different from the previous one ; for example , bombing versus robbery ( allac k is the only type that is in general consistent with all other event types ) ; ( 2 ) the definiteness of a primar y phrase ; for nouns , it usually coincides with the definiteness of the noun phrase that describes an event ; ( 3 ) the amount of text with no secondary phrases that separates the current and previous primary phrases .
definition.definiens: influence the decision as to whether a subsequent paragraph or sentenc e continues describing an event or starts describing a new event : ( 1 ) whether an event type that the current primary phrase has identified is different from the previous one ; for example , bombing versus robbery

definition.sentence: 260 TRUMPET TRUMPET is a domain-driven program that coordinates with the parser in order to interpret connected text .
definition.definiens: a domain-driven program that coordinates with the parser in order to interpret connected text

definition.sentence: If the current EStructs are not compatible , TRUMPET deactivates the current CEStruct and creates a new active CEStruct which is initialized wit h the current EStructs .
definition.definiens: deactivates the current CEStruct and creates a new active CEStruct which is initialized wit h the current EStructs

definition.sentence: TRUMPET uses the text segmentation produced by DPM to separate conceptual representations concerning different events .
definition.definiens: uses the text segmentation produced by DPM to separate conceptual representations concerning different events

definition.sentence: LSI 'S DBG MESSAGE UNDERSTANDING SYSTEM : DISCOURSE PROCESSIN G LSI 's approach to discourse processing is based on the notion of text grammar , which was originally defined by Propp [ 27 ] and has more recently been elaborated by van Dijk [ 9 ] , [ 10 ] , and others .
definition.definiens: DISCOURSE PROCESSIN G LSI 's approach to discourse processing is based on the notion of text grammar

definition.sentence: The DBG system output for the processing of each message is a text level knowledge representation fo r the message content consisting of a set of instantiated event and object frames called templates .
definition.definiens: a text level knowledge representation fo r the message content consisting of a set of instantiated event

definition.sentence: The Report template is a `meta template ' , which considers the message itself as a reporting event over and above the actual event s described in the message .
definition.definiens: a `meta template ' , which considers the message itself as a reporting event over and above the actual event s described in the message

definition.sentence: In addition to header slots containing information about the reporting event itself , the Report template contains a set of slots that point to the internal ( DBG ) event/action templates generated for the text .
definition.definiens: contains a set of slots that point to the internal ( DBG ) event/action templates generated for the text

definition.sentence: The Template Unexpected Input Module ( TUX ) of th e DBG system , which tries to fill empty template slots using unexpected information encountered in the text , uses discourse information about text ( e .
definition.definiens: tries to fill empty template slots using unexpected information encountered in the text , uses discourse information about text ( e

definition.sentence: Military messages , for example , are typically designed to conve y particular types of information precisely , whereas the broader , journalistic function of the MUC-3 messages makes the particular details mentioned less predictable , and stylistic variation appears to be more highly valued in a non-military domain , such as MUC-3 .
definition.definiens: typically designed to conve y particular types of information precisely , whereas the broader

definition.sentence: Moreover , the sentences in the MUC-3 messages are characterized by a non-hypotactic or `loose ' syntactic structure , relying heavily on postposed apposition , coordination , and subordination , which makes them cumbersome to process .
definition.definiens: makes them cumbersome to process

definition.sentence: CBR allows us to benefit from th e development corpus by examining how parser output correlated with key templates in previous texts .
definition.definiens: allows us to benefit from th e development corpus by examining how parser output correlated with key templates in previous texts

definition.sentence: For this task , UMass uses an elaborate set of rules which reflect relevan t properties of the MUC-3 corpus and in certain cases embody knowledge about text structure .
definition.definiens: uses an elaborate set of rules which reflect relevan t properties of the MUC-3 corpus and in certain cases embody knowledge about text structure

definition.sentence: GE enhances merging with an initial pre parsing segmentation of a story into portions of text that are relevant for different events .
definition.definiens: merging with an initial pre parsing segmentation of a story into portions of text that are relevant for different events

definition.sentence: ITP uses knowledge about the world and relation s between entities in different situations to resolve pronouns .
definition.definiens: uses knowledge about the world and relation s between entities in different situations to resolve pronouns

definition.sentence: The sentence parser is a second parser that is responsible for constructing a single parse tree for eac h sentence in the message .
definition.definiens: a second parser that is responsible for constructing a single parse tree for eac h sentence in the message

definition.sentence: • TOKENIZER – A tokenizer module ( which comes as part of the NL-Builder system ) is used for markin g text into tokens and identifying patterns that may not be in the dictionary ( numbers , proper nouns , etc. ) .
definition.definiens: comes as part of the NL-Builder system

definition.sentence: Notice that the phrase interpreter has established mappings ( via 'SI , ' or Semantic Interpretation , links ) between the syntactic nodes produced by the phrase parser , and concept nodes in the semantic net : NP1110063B20 ISA NP ; HEAD `` SHINING PATH '' ; DETERMINER `` A '' ; NUMBER SINGULAR ; PERSON THIRD ; SI ORGANIZATION35 ; VP1110063B40 ISA VP ; VERB `` BOMBING '' ; SI BOMB .
definition.definiens: the syntactic nodes produced by the phrase parser , and concept nodes in the semantic net : NP1110063B20 ISA NP

definition.definiens: the sentence interpreter has identified the Shining Path organization as the perpetrator of th e bombing action

definition.sentence: Recall is a measure of the completeness of the template fill .
definition.definiens: a measure of the completeness of the template fill

definition.sentence: Recall is a measure of completeness and was calculated as follows .
definition.definiens: a measure of completeness and was calculated as follows

definition.sentence: PRE=COR + ( PAR X 0 .5 ) ACT 39 + ( 0 x 0 .5 ) 4 1 3 9 4 1 = 0.95 Overgeneration is a measure of spurious generation and was calculated a s follows .
OVG = ACT ' 2 1 109 = 0 .1 9 Fallout is a measure of the false alarm rate .
definition.definiens: a measure of the false alarm rate

definition.sentence: E ( IUI Ikeyvall ) keyva l where keyval stands for each of the key values including blanks , IUI is th e cardinality of the finite set U of possible slot fillers , and Ikeyvall is the number of key values corresponding to the response .
definition.definiens: th e cardinality of the finite set U of possible slot fillers

definition.sentence: Precision is the accuracy with which a system extracts data .
The features selected for BOMBING ( an incident type filler ) fit one 's intuitions of what good feature s should look like .
definition.definiens: an incident type filler ) fit one 's intuitions of what good feature s should look like

definition.sentence: Also complicating a `` pure '' test is the penalty for spurious fills included in those slots where the appositives were present ; again , an error unrelated to the fill that contained the appositive .
definition.definiens: the penalty for spurious fills included in those slots where the appositives were present

definition.sentence: A topic is a set of contiguous sentences with the same computed value for TYPE OF INCIDENT .
A relevant sentence shares the same topic with the previous sentence or contains no competin g topic .
definition.definiens: shares the same topic with the previous sentence or contains no competin g topic

definition.sentence: The test message indexing involves the determination of which of the single terms and phrase s in the system vocabulary are contained in the message .

definition.sentence: The `` non-parsing '' systems are ADS , HU , MDC , UNI , UNL , UNL-01 , and UNL-02 , and the `` parsing '' systems are BBN , BBN-O , GE , GTE , ITP , LSI , NYU , NYU-01 , NYU-02 , PRC , SRI , SYN , UMA , and UMA-O .

definition.sentence: The C/Lisp implementation used in MUC-3 was designed to facilitate knowledge engineering and experimentation with parameters and algorithm s that will at least partially automate adaptation to new domains and applications .
definition.definiens: used in MUC-3 was designed to facilitate knowledge engineering and experimentation with parameters and algorithm s that will at least partially automate adaptation to new domains and applications

definition.sentence: The Cognitive Model contains specific reference marker s identifying events and individuals in the text .
definition.definiens: contains specific reference marker s identifying events and individuals in the text

definition.sentence: The Cognitive Model distinguishe s between events , individuals and sets .
Finally , the Cognitive Model indicated discourse segments .
Case-based consolidation generates additional templates that might have been missed o r dismissed during the rule-based analysis , and thereby reduces the number of missing templates .
definition.definiens: generates additional templates that might have been missed o r dismissed during the rule-based analysis , and thereby reduces the number of missing templates

definition.sentence: LICKs describe syntactic and semantic interactions within CIRCUS as it interprets embedded clauses .
definition.definiens: describe syntactic and semantic interactions within CIRCUS as it interprets embedded clauses

definition.sentence: S14 introduces new temporal information , today , which introduces a new segment containing an event occurring o n October 24 , 1989 .
definition.definiens: introduces a new segment containing an event occurring o n October 24

definition.sentence: The ITP Segmentation Module enables the Template Reasoning Module to recognize five possibl e templates , discard Segment 3 and Segment 4 as irrelevant incidents , and precisely choose th e correct three templates from Segments 1 , 2 , and 5 .
definition.definiens: enables the Template Reasoning Module to recognize five possibl e templates , discard Segment 3 and Segment 4 as irrelevant incidents

definition.sentence: INSTRUMENT : TYPE ( S ) -The device used by the perpetrator ( s ) i n carrying out the terrorist act .
definition.definiens: TYPE ( S ) -The device used by the perpetrator ( s ) i n carrying out the terrorist act

definition.sentence: Text string : A string extracted from the text and placed inside double quote s in the slot .
definition.definiens: A string extracted from the text and placed inside double quote s in the slot

definition.sentence: Applicability : Applicable to all types of incident s Number of fillers : One filler per template , or NULL ( hyphen ) if nature o f perpetrator can not be determined .
definition.definiens: Applicable to all types of incident s Number of fillers : One filler per template , or

definition.sentence: Cross-referencing : Include cross-reference to PHYSICAL TARGET : ID ( S ) .
definition.definiens: Include cross-reference to PHYSICAL TARGET : ID ( S )

definition.sentence: INTRODUCTION GTE has actively participated in the Third Annual Message Understanding Conference ( MUC-3 ) sponsored by the Naval Ocean System Center ( NOSC ) for the past 7 months using its natural language processing system , TIA ( Text Interpretation Aid ) [ 5 ] .
definition.definiens: actively participated in the Third Annual Message Understanding Conference ( MUC-3 ) sponsored by the Naval Ocean System Center

definition.sentence: Recall Recall is a maximized scoring metric which measures the amount of data extracted from messages and inserte d into message templates during the parsing and extraction processes .
definition.definiens: a maximized scoring metric which measures the amount of data extracted from messages and inserte d into message templates during the parsing and extraction processes

definition.sentence: Precision ( PRE ) measures the correctness of the information extracted from the messages and placed in the templates during the parsing processes .
definition.definiens: measures the correctness of the information extracted from the messages and placed in the templates during the parsing processes

definition.sentence: OverGeneration Overgeneration is the scoring metric which measures extraneous template fills , i.e. , the percentage of templates which were incorrectly spawned during the parsing and extraction processes .
definition.definiens: the scoring metric which measures extraneous template fills , i.e. , the percentage of templates which were incorrectly spawned during the parsing and extraction processes

definition.sentence: After further review of TIA 's internal representation of the message , a murder -p structured concept wa s properly instantiated with , '' JECAR NEGHME '' , a SPOKESMAN for the MIR , thereby properly identifying the appropriate human target .
definition.definiens: for the MIR , thereby properly identifying the appropriate human target

definition.sentence: Lexicon Learner and Sorter Tools The lexicon learner tool/utility automates the process of entering unknown ( essentially undefined ) words and/or phrases into the appropriate syntactic lexicon with the appropriate syntactic and semantic features .
definition.definiens: automates the process of entering unknown ( essentially undefined ) words and/or phrases into the appropriate syntactic lexicon with the appropriate syntactic and semantic features

definition.sentence: The city Achi is defined by a Def-Region macro which maintains fields for grammar , syntax , part-of , and type .
definition.definiens: maintains fields for grammar , syntax , part-of , and type

definition.sentence: EXAMPLE : TEXT `` X OCCURRED ON AUGUST 30 , 1989 , AND Y OCCURRED A WEEK LATER '' RESPONSE ( for Y ) 06 SEP 89 KEY ( for Y ) 30 AUG 89 15 SEP 89 ( where the latter date is the date of the article ) PARTIALLY CORRECT : occurred between two dates or if the filler in the key is a default value , i .
definition.definiens: the date of the article ) PARTIALLY CORRECT : occurred between two dates or if the filler in the

definition.sentence: EXAMPLES : RESPONSE 26 AUG 89 KEY 25 AUG 89-26 AUG 89 RESPONSE 26 AUG 89 KEY 26 AUG 89 ( default fill ) RESPONSE 25 AUG 89 KEY -26 AUG 89 ( default fill ) System response is a default-looking value ( as described above ) and the ke y is a bounded range that has the date of the message dateline as the uppe r anchor .
definition.definiens: a bounded range that has the date of the message dateline as the uppe r anchor

definition.sentence: NOTE : The scoring program will automatically score the system response partially correct in the case where the system generates SUSPECTED OR ACCUSED instead o f SUSPECTED OR ACCUSED BY AUTHORITIES .
